intro: Cyclosorus × pseudoliukiuensis, commonly known as the hybrid water clover, is a rare aquatic plant species belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its intricate, lobed leaves that resemble a clover leaf, often floating on the water surface. This plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes. Its reproductive structures are simple, with small flowers that are usually submerged, facilitating pollination by water-borne agents. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
